Nerfs to ad all around and buffs to MR items.

Next Skarner rework:

Skarner historically has been too much of a ranged champion. E has been replaced with a new spell that slows enemies that attack Skarner in melee range.

Skarner was too fast and "clingy."  Movement speed and attack range reduced.

Buff: Skarner now has even MORE attack speed and 2% more slow on his crystal slash.

Skarners Ult was OP. Skarner no longer has an ult. Instead he passively gives enemies [1/2/3]gp/10 and gets [1/2/3]g on each cs.

He wins lane harder now. 0.o I've used him a number of times and the fact you don't have to put any points into the W at all now is wonderful. You just pour it all into Q and E for damage and ArP and laugh as your bleed stacks cleaver on top of giving you a perma speed buff. It's wonderful.
dont forget that if you just aa a siege minion 5 times you get to apply full stacks to the enemy champ free of any previous penalties.  yay!
Doesn't his passive only begin when he reaches 5 stacks on a champion?

honestly, i think that all of the changes were unnecessary and/or just plain bad.  darius's fighting power just went through the roof when all he needed was some tweaking, mordekaiser had his identity pissed on and then a pet dragon added in, garen got turned from an easy simple champ into an armored sack of overly complex mechanics, and skarner is just freaking weird.  yes, a few tweaks were needed for some of them, but this is rediculous.

> [{quoted}](name=I Main Swain,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=AIA9E3hk,comment-id=000a,timestamp=2015-08-06T02:04:09.170+0000)

>rediculous.

Ridiculous*

That describes my problem with updates. I'm sure all 4 of them could be perfectly viable, provided they sit on the PBE for tuning way longer than Riot is intending them to be. The issue is that these changes read like something pulled from the champion concepts section.

Garen got complex mechanics?

I wish he is still ultra simple

Riot stated they want him to be noob friendly champ

The only new mechanic is, "Do more damage to the last person to get a kill on the enemy team."

Not really complex, honestly.

> [{quoted}](name=ElJanitorFrank,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=AIA9E3hk,comment-id=000a00010000,timestamp=2015-08-06T05:25:45.279+0000)

Gotta watch the map and make sure no one is dying when you engage on an enemy and want to press R.

Otherwise they could fuck up your entire duel and get you killed.
They said it won't change during combat
mordekaiser barely needed tweaking, then they do this

Complex.
Really? An icon appears over the enemies head who you deal bonus damage to. That's it.

His ult is still the same as before.

his ult isn't the only thing they changed.  now his w no longer gives % bonus armor/mr but instead gives you 0.2 armor and mr for each minion killed up to 30 bonus.  his e also now slows him when he's moving towards an enemy champ who he's also damaging with his e.  and then the passive on his ult is out of place and unnecessary.  he didn't need anything, and in comparison to before he is complex.

did you look at any of the changes?  the icon was a minor part of the whole thing.
They stated they are going to remove the slow on e I believe

If you read the patch notes into Darius he's actually getting nerfed significantly across the board. Q now has delay and significantly less damage. Bleed now physical damage, less damage, no longer applies ms. Ultimate significantly less damage. 

Oh but if you can apply "five" stacks of bleed on somebody you get to deal extra damage. Also we are nerfing your attack speed as well just for lols. 

There's literally no reason to play this version of Darius over other champions.

I get the feeling this is kind of like what theyve done before. Shelving him because hes unhealthy, then worrying about him later. We also have to see how different item changes affect things in the future. This may be some planning ahead on their part that we would have no way of knowing about.

Yep I get this feeling as well, except normally they just throw in a "patch" that gutters a champion, then release a grand rework later to fix it. This is supposed to be the grand rework. He's probably going to stay butchered sadly.
I dunno, they did some more stuff now with him. A 90% slow at all ranks on his w, with reduced mana costs on his q. As of right now he can go titanic hydra into full tank and be a fucking monster.

The thing is that Riot sometimes release to strong items and yes nerf champions ahead of time (basically forcing them into building the item)... but then they nerf the item and then the nerfed champion is often screwed and often just left in the dumpster

I am glad I wasn't the only one to make that skarner joke.

I'm totally down with garen and morde's changes though. I actually wanna play garen for one thing, now.
the morde changes seem pretty bad, coming from a morde main

I get that, and I like morde a lot, though I don't main him. But I'm really interested in giving it a try at least. I like the idea of a replacement for a marksman, and the new triple damage on his Q thing.

And who knows, it might be pretty cool? They had to lower his movespeed because in testing they felt like he was inescapable and TOO strong. I want to see if this shakes things up.

Like I said, I want to actually try it out before I determine if it's a thing I like or not.

He had to build a shit ton of movespeed for it (he has no CC or actual movespeed buffs for himself) 

now he's forced to build it in order to even be relevant, and I'll still just laugh him off as he becomes worse than useless thanks to CertainlyTerrible designs 

{{champion:27}} gets it on his ult, {{champion:77}} gets it on a normal ability with hard CC on top of it

i'm not playing mord bot, if he's forced to go bot only then I guess I'm out of a mid lane lol
i might be getting dead man's plate on him, that seems like it would be decent
I don't really trust their reasoning on him being "inescapable", because anyone with a brain hits him with one CC and he's off you.
his base MS was already one of the lowest
I just...don't really know what they were trying to do with Skarner there. He was fine {{item:3073}}

honestly, i think he may have been a little bit too strong.  while he is melee, it's pretty hard to stay away from him and his damage is really high.  having never played him in a real game i cant really judge, but i would guess it's like nasus and volibear (where if you're good at them you just plain win).
It's not that he is "strong" it's that he was feast or famine, he sucked if he wasn't getting fed, and if he gets fed he just destroys everything.
xins passive? wtf it reduces armor the new garen ult has %health true damage so don't dis him.
both are marks on a single target that increases your damage against that person, but geran's is much worse
